author: @jerryjacob6996

text: The biggest issue with the Vida scooter is the sudden activation of limp mode‚Äîit can stop in the middle of the road while you're riding, posing a serious risk of accidents. Another drawback is its range, which is lower compared to other scooters with the same battery capacity. Apart from these concerns, it‚Äôs otherwise a good scooter.
author: @RahulRaj-gd4lm

text: Limp mode is removed in v1 models itself and display shows true range unlike ola.
author: @adityagore8398

text:
‚Äã¬†@adityagore8398¬†
Thanks for your reply.
In V2,  company has renamed "Limp mode" to "Speed Limit," but the behavior remains the same. It still activates suddenly, often in the middle of the road. I strongly believe this feature should be completely removed for safety reasons.
 
Regarding the true range, while I agree that the true range is displayed on the screen, my concern is about the vehicle‚Äôs efficiency. The per-kilowatt range seems relatively low compared to other brands in the same segment.
author: @RahulRaj-gd4lm

text:
‚Äã¬†@RahulRaj-gd4lm¬† It simply denotes that battery is loosely connected. Once you connect your battery to connector properly, it vanishes. Nothing deal-breaker. 
Considering range issue, I am using vida v2 lite, it gives me approximately 70 on eco mode which is at par Considering other vehicles.
author: @adityagore8398

text: ‚Äã¬†@adityagore8398¬†For the V2 Lite, could you share how much it cost you ‚Äî both the ex-showroom price and the on-road price? I'm planning to buy an electric scooter and exploring options.

text: Bhai aap e-scooter se kitni dur jana chahte hai daily?? Mostly Indians daily 50-60 km ka hi travel karte hai scooter se. Wo bhi jo padhne ya job pe jate ho. Itna to EV de hi rahi hai. Aur kya chahiye?? Long distance travel me EV car bhi atleast 400 km ki range deti hai. Jo mostly indians ke liye enough hai. Jyadatar Indians city me hi travel karte hai daily. Jo log usse bhi dur jate hai un logo ke liye EV kisi kaam ki nahi. Unke liye ICE vehicles hai hi.
